intro: Linociera novoguineensis, commonly known as the New Guinea linociera, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of New Guinea. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and large, heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture. Its flowers are typically pink or red, with five petals and numerous stamens, making it visually striking. It is often found in moist, shaded environments within lowland forests.
